result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis R Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violation of Individual at Risk Restraining Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.123(10).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to the probation in 22CM257.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during period of probation, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Any cash bail should be applied to any financial obligations.

-Participate in Battery Prevention Program.
-Referral to/ Mental health evaluation and any mental health Tx recommended.
-Provide DNA Sample.
*Court advised defendant that it MIGHT be a crime to possess a firearm, but has not decided today.

charges.descr: Violation of Individual at Risk Restraining Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis R Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to the probation in 22CM257. Sentence imposed and stayed and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Participate in Battery Prevention Program.
-Referral to/ Mental health evaluation and any mental health Tx recommended.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-No contact with victim
-Restitution set to ZERO
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during period of probation, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Any cash bail should be applied to any financial obligations. 
-Provide DNA Sample. 

*Court advised defendant that it MIGHT be a crime to possess a firearm, but has not decided today. Defendant is under advisement. 
*Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Luis R Martinez in court.  Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court for Luis R Martinez.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant. Amended Information discussed amongst parties prior to defendant's plea. 

Count 1 dismissed, but defendant plead to amended charge (now count 2). 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Due to court calendar congestion, Court is unable to hear this matter. Case spun to Branch 25, Judge Franke in 506 of the Safety Building. Parties notified.

Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions
Pretrial Services Discharge Report 7-21-2022, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 7-14-2022, filed.
Letter Response Re Pretrial Services Report of June 27, 2022, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 6-27-2022, filed.

Defendant Luis R Martinez in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears. Court cancels the bench warrant. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a scheduling conference.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-6-2022, filed.

Defendant Luis R Martinez in court with attorney Thomas J. Schneck.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calendar call held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Court cancels the stayed bench warrant. Defense requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-10-2022, filed.
filed.

Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Calendar call scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM014949  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 03/21/2022
Pretrial Services Violation Report 3-18-2022, filed.

Defendant Luis R Martinez in court by video with Attorney Thomas J. Schneck who appeared in person.  Defendant Luis R Martinez in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer R. Mseitif. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
by Attorney Schneck, filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 021561,
Payable Number: 990234,
Receipt Number: 22RP009100,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with Julie A.M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Luis R Martinez in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Luis R Martinez in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luis R Martinez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
